intro: Canthium heudelotii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds. Canthium heudelotii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
